alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued February 27 at 6:54PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Northwest Avalanche Center. ...The Northwest Avalanche Center in Seattle has issued an Avalanche Warning... * WHAT...Heavy rain and snow along with warming temperatures and strong winds will create very dangerous avalanche conditions. A widespread natural avalanche cycle is expected in many areas. * WHERE...High danger for the West slopes of the Washington Cascades from the Canadian Border to the Columbia River, including Stevens, Snoqualmie, and White passes; also the east slopes of the Washington Cascades from the Canadian border down to and including the I-90 corridor. * WHEN...In effect from Feb 27th Sun 6:00 PM PST through Feb 28th Mon 6:00 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Avalanches may become very large and destructive, and run to valley bottoms. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Stay off of and well out from underneath steep slopes at all elevations. Consult https://www.nwac.us/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
